Description: Two joining fragments of neck and strap handle, with gradual curve, of a Knidian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine pink-buff; some mica. Rectangular stamp.
Type series: KT2102 (Virginia Grace's unpublished K(nidian) T(ype) series)
Curator's comments: Name Philinos. The name appears on Knidian 'prow' stamps of c.325-275 BC, and on a piece from Olbia Pontica, dated to post-110 BC by Jefremov (Die Amphorenstempel des Hellenistischen Knidos, 221, no. 966. Our handle seems early.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (323)
